**The Method of Invocations Within the Cavernous Mystery and Numinous Treasure Liturgy**

**Text Title:** *The Method of Invocations Within the Cavernous Mystery and Numinous Treasure Liturgy*
*Author unknown, approximately composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties. An early liturgical manual of the Celestial Masters’ tradition for talismanic summons, its contents closely resemble those of the* **Ritual of the Ten Talismanic Summonses from the Orthodox Texts**. *One scroll. Base text from:* **The Orthodox Daoist Canon, Proper Section I**.

---

### **The Method of Invocations Within the Cavernous Mystery and Numinous Treasure Liturgy**
#### **Purple Void Register Ritual**

On the day of the new moon in the month of [X], in the year [X] (cyclical year), [X] of the [X] Peak, the Realized One [X], born in the year [X], month [X], day [X], hour [X], whose celestial registry is under [X] Heaven. According to the *Nayin* (Five Phases resonance) calculation of their life destiny, if their fate is Wood, they belong to the Azure Heaven, and their *qi* is governed by the Heavenly Lord of [X]. For example, those born in *jiazi* (1st year of the sexagenary cycle) or *bingzi* (13th year) are registered under the Forbidden Upper Heaven.

Now, within the *qi* of this Heaven—this being the *qi* of the master—bind the Azure (east) and the Vermilion (south) clouds.

- **Yin (3rd Earthly Branch) and Mao (4th Earthly Branch):** Azure Emperor, Nine Heavens, Nine *Qi*
- **Si (6th Earthly Branch) and Wu (7th Earthly Branch):** Vermilion Emperor, Three Heavens, Three *Qi*
- **Shen (9th Earthly Branch) and You (10th Earthly Branch):** White Emperor, Seven Heavens, Seven *Qi*
- **Hai (12th Earthly Branch) and Zi (1st Earthly Branch):** Black Emperor, Five Heavens, Five *Qi*
- **Chen (5th Earthly Branch), Xu (11th Earthly Branch), Chou (2nd Earthly Branch), and Wei (8th Earthly Branch):** Yellow Emperor, One Heaven, One *Qi*

Having received the [X] grade of talismanic register from the Orthodox Unity (*Zhengyi*) tradition, the invocations for summoning *qi* vary by grade. The following are listed accordingly:

- **Born in *zi* (1st Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Central Mystery
- **Born in *mao* (4th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Upper Beginning
- **Born in *wu* (7th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Two *Qi* of Supreme Origin
- **Born in *you* (10th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Lower Origin
- **Born in *chou* (2nd Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Lower Mystery
- **Born in *chen* (5th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Central Beginning
- **Born in *wei* (8th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Upper Origin
- **Born in *xu* (11th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Supreme Mystery
- **Born in *yin* (3rd Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Supreme Beginning
- **Born in *si* (6th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Lower Beginning
- **Born in *shen* (9th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Central Origin
- **Born in *hai* (12th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Three *Qi* of Upper Mystery

The above Three Generals’ invocations of *qi* are as described; the Star Rigidity (*Xinggang*) invocations follow the same pattern.

- **Born in the Four Cardinal Months (*yin*, *shen*, *si*, *hai*):** Summoned by the Lord of Transformative *Qi* of the Supreme Clarity and Subtle Heaven of Grand Purity
- **Born in the Four Central Months (*zi*, *wu*, *mao*, *you*):** Summoned by the Lord of Protective *Qi* of the Supreme Yuanyu Heaven
- **Born in the Four Seasonal Months (*chen*, *xu*, *chou*, *wei*):** Summoned by the Lord of Talismanic *Qi* of the Supreme Great Vermilion Heaven

The above invocations apply to the *qi* summons of the Hundred Ghosts Register; the Demon-Slaying Register follows the same pattern.

- **From *jiazi* (1st year) to *wuchen* (5th year):** Summon the Supreme Clarity Lord of the Grand Yang of the Grand Clarity Heaven of Grand Purity
- **From *jiayin* (51st year) to *wuwu* (55th year):** Summon the Supreme Clarity Lord of the Pervasive Yang of the Grand Clarity Heaven of Grand Purity
- **From *jiachen* (41st year) to *wushen* (45th year):** Summon the Supreme Mystery Lord of the Subtle Yang of the Yuanyu Heaven
- **From *jiawu* (31st year) to *wuxu* (35th year):** Summon the Supreme Origin Lord of the Grand Yin of the Yuanyu Heaven
- **From *jiashen* (21st year) to *wuzi* (25th year):** Summon the Supreme Origin Lord of the Pervasive Yin of the Great Vermilion Heaven
- **From *jiaxu* (11th year) to *wuyin* (15th year):** Summon the Supreme Beginning Lord of the Subtle Yin of the Great Vermilion Heaven
- **From *jisi* (6th year) to *guiyou* (10th year):** Summon the Supreme Beginning Lord of the Grand Yang of the Grand Clarity Heaven of Grand Purity
- **From *jiwei* (56th year) to *guihai* (60th year):** Summon the Supreme Mystery Lord of the Subtle Yang of the Grand Clarity Heaven of Grand Purity
- **From *jiyou* (46th year) to *guichou* (50th year):** Summon the Supreme Mystery Lord of the Pervasive Yang of the Yuanyu Heaven
- **From *jihai* (36th year) to *guimao* (40th year):** Summon the Supreme Origin Lord of the Grand Yin of the Yuanyu Heaven
- **From *jichou* (26th year) to *guiwei* (30th year):** Summon the Supreme Beginning Lord of the Subtle Yin of the Great Vermilion Heaven
- **From *jimao* (16th year) to *guiwei* (20th year):** Summon the Supreme Beginning Lord of the Pervasive Yin of the Great Vermilion Heaven

The above Azure Register invocations are determined by the disciple’s current age.

- **Born in *zi* (1st Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Northern Great Spirit, the Double Brightness
- **Born in *wu* (7th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Southern Great Sparkling Deluder, the Grand Yang Radiant *Qi*
- **Left:** Summon the Lord of the Central Di of Supreme Mystery
- **Right:** Summon the Lord of the Central Man of the Supreme Origin Emperor
- **Born in *chou* (2nd Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Northern Great Spirit, the Yellow Spirit of the Central Chen
- **Born in *wei* (8th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Southern Great Sparkling Deluder, the Yellow Numinous Transformation
- **Central:** Summon the Lord of the Seven Treasures of the Central Origin
- **Central:** Summon the Lord of the Three Supreme Beginnings of the Central Yellow
- **Born in *yin* (3rd Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Eastern Double Flower, the Manifest Yang
- **Born in *shen* (9th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Western Grand White, the Golden City of the Child Liu, the Radiant Yin
- **Left:** Summon the Lord of the Upper Yi of the Mysterious Dao *Qi*
- **Right:** Summon the Lord of the Upper Rong of the True Conveyance
- **Born in *mao* (4th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Eastern Double Flower, the Radiant Yang
- **Born in *you* (10th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Western Grand White, the Golden City of the Child Liu, the Double Radiance of Heaven
- **Left:** Summon the Lord of the Central Yi of the Pervasive Clarity
- **Right:** Summon the Lord of the Central Rong of the Grand Simplicity
- **Born in *chen* (5th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Eastern Double Flower, the Yellow Clarity of the Central Transformation
- **Born in *xu* (11th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Western Grand White, the Golden City of the Child Liu, the Yellow Transformation of the Northern
- **Central:** Summon the Nine Perfected Lords of the Three Supreme Beginnings of the Central Yellow *Qi*
- **Central:** Summon the Lord of the Five *Qi* of the Supreme Origin
- **Born in *si* (6th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Southern Great Sparkling Deluder, the Yang Brightness
- **Born in *hai* (12th Earthly Branch):** Summon the Lord of the Northern Great Chen, the Radiant Splendor
- **Right:** Summon the Lord of the Upper Man of the Cavernous Clarity
- **Left:** Summon the Lord of the Upper Di of the Cavernous Perfection

The above pertains to the Vermilion Register invocations of immortals.

The invocations for the Register of the Original Destiny’s Vermilion Talisman are as follows:

- **Born in the 1st month:** Summon the Lord of the Upper Yi
- **Born in the 2nd month:** Summon the Lord of the Central Yi
- **Born in the 3rd month:** Summon the Lord of the Lower Yi
- **Born in the 4th month:** Summon the Lord of the Upper Man
- **Born in the 5th month:** Summon the Lord of the Central Man
- **Born in the 6th month:** Summon the Lord of the Lower Man
- **Born in the 7th month:** Summon the Lord of the Upper Rong
- **Born in the 8th month:** Summon the Lord of the Central Rong
- **Born in the 9th month:** Summon the Lord of the Lower Rong
- **Born in the 10th month:** Summon the Lord of the Upper Di
- **Born in the 11th month:** Summon the Lord of the Central Di
- **Born in the 12th month:** Summon the Lord of the Lower Di

The above pertains to the Register of the Original Destiny’s Vermilion Talisman.

- **For men whose age is unknown:** Use the invocation of the Lower Lord of the Nine
- **For women whose age is unknown:** Use the invocation of the Lower Lord of the Grand Yin

The invocations for the Register of the One Hundred Fifty Generals, determined by birth month, are as follows:

- **Born in the 1st month:** Summon the Lord of the Five *Qi* of the Central Radiance of the Lower Supreme Mystery and Subtle Clarity
- **Born in the 2nd month:** Summon the Lord of the Jade Pervasive *Qi* of the Mysterious Principle
- **Born in the 3rd month:** Summon the Lord of the Right Office’s Radiant *Qi* of the Central Mystery
- **Born in the 4th month:** Summon the Lord of the Transformative *Qi* of the Lower Mystery’s Subtle Generation
- **Born in the 5th month:** Summon the Lord of the *Qi* of the Subtle Brightness of the Central Origin’s Office of Supreme Mystery
- **Born in the 6th month:** Summon the Lord of the *Qi* of the Left Calendar of the Central Office of the Upper Origin
- **Born in the 7th month:** Summon the Lord of the *Qi* of the Left Office’s Calendar of the Central Origin
- **Born in the 8th month:** Summon the Lord of the Transformative *Qi* of the Central Mechanism of the Lower Origin’s Double Radiance
- **Born in the 9th month:** Summon the Lord of the Numinous *Qi* of the Ten Thousand Guides of the Central Opening of Supreme Beginning

**Born in the 10th month:** Summon the Lord of the *Qi* of the Upper Beginning’s Luminous Guide of the Post Station.

Those of either sex who receive the celestial summons of the immortals may do so according to the above. If the birth month is unknown, the 12th month’s summons should be used.

The register of the Upper Numinous Office’s summons is as follows:
- **Born in the 1st month:** Summon the Lord of the Eastern Upper Yi of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 2nd month:** Summon the Lord of the Eastern Middle Yi of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 3rd month:** Summon the Lord of the Eastern Lower Yi of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 4th month:** Summon the Lord of the Southern Upper Man of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 5th month:** Summon the Lord of the Southern Middle Man of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 6th month:** Summon the Lord of the Southern Lower Man of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 7th month:** Summon the Lord of the Western Upper Rong of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 8th month:** Summon the Lord of the Western Middle Rong of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 9th month:** Summon the Lord of the Western Lower Rong of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 10th month:** Summon the Lord of the Northern Upper Di of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 11th month:** Summon the Lord of the Northern Middle Di of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below
- **Born in the 12th month:** Summon the Lord of the Northern Lower Di of the Nine Elders of the Unbound Below

Those of either sex who receive the register of the Upper Numinous Office’s summons follow this method. If the birth month is unknown, the 12th month’s summons should be used.

Those born in:
- **Zi (子):** Belong to the Star of Greedy Wolf, the Black Emperor’s Child, of the Heaven of Vacuous Transcendence and the Celestial Balance
- **Chou (丑):** Belong to the Star of Great Gate, the Yellow Emperor’s Child, of the Heaven of the Seven Luminaries’ Supreme Clarity
- **Yin (寅):** Belong to the Star of Emolument Store, the Azure Emperor’s Child, of the Heaven of Primordial Clarity and Literary Eminence
- **Mao (卯):** Belong to the Star of Literary Brilliance, the Azure Emperor’s Child
- **Chen (辰):** Belong to the Star of Integrity and Chastity, the Yellow Emperor’s Child, of the Heaven of Observing Clarity and Upright Stillness
- **Si (巳):** Belong to the Star of Martial Brilliance, the Vermilion Emperor’s Child
- **Wu (午):** Belong to the Star of Army Breaker, the Vermilion Emperor’s Child
- **Wei (未):** Belong to the Star of Martial Brilliance, the Yellow Emperor’s Child
- **Shen (申):** Belong to the Star of Integrity and Chastity, the White Emperor’s Child, of the Heaven of Observing Clarity and Upright Stillness
- **You (酉):** Belong to the Star of Literary Brilliance, the White Emperor’s Child
- **Xu (戌):** Belong to the Star of Emolument Store, the Yellow Emperor’s Child, of the Heaven of Primordial Clarity and Literary Eminence
- **Hai (亥):** Belong to the Star of Great Gate, the Black Emperor’s Child, of the Heaven of the Seven Luminaries’ Supreme Clarity

An outline of the rites for dissolving the register, briefly expounding the orthodox unity of the Dao.

The register is that which disciplines the emotions and nature through precepts, blocks transgressions and wrongdoing, severs the roots of evil, and gives rise to the Daoist vocation. From the mortal to the sagely, from beginning to end, one must first receive the register of precepts. Thus, when first ascending to the realm of the perfected, all matters exist in duality, and in duality there is no principle that does not penetrate.

The register is also called the "register," the wondrous *qi* of the Three Heavens, the names and titles of the divine officials of the ten directions and the immortals, bestowed upon those who practice the Dao. As the scriptures say: "Those who live without a Daoist rank become lowly ghosts in death." Among worldly scholars and eminent persons who aspire to the Dao but cannot yet relinquish worldly glory and emolument, one cannot receive the register all at once at the outset. They may first receive the third or fifth rank, and if their cultivation bears merit, they may then advance to higher ranks.

The perfected of antiquity, consulting the scriptural records, would receive only one or two ranks for their practice and thereby ascend to the position of the highest perfected. If one receives many ranks but does not cultivate, fails to comprehend the ultimate principle, or does not understand the reasons for practice, it will not benefit the Dao. One must apply the mind with sincerity and align practice with the true Way—then the Dao will unfailingly respond, and its response will be as if divine.

The Orthodox Unity register was first transmitted into the world in twenty-four ranks, corresponding to the twenty-four vital breaths of life. Here, we briefly elucidate one or two ranks to clarify the origin of Orthodox Unity.

The register of the One Hundred Fifty Generals of Orthodox Unity’s Three-Five ranks has two levels: the upper is called "Upper Immortal," and the lower is called "Upper Spirit." Both are the true deities of the Two Modes within the human body.

We further explain the origin of the Orthodox Unity Three-Five Primal Mandate Perfected Person’s Vermilion Register. "Orthodox Unity" is the sovereign of all methods, subduing deceit and falsehood to return all to the true Dao. "Primal Chaos" refers to the moment when my body first received *qi* at birth, akin to the initial chaos of heaven and earth. "Primal Mandate" is the original mandate of my body; one who knows the Dao and cultivates this mandate may become a perfected person. The principles of the Primal Mandate are vast and enduring, and their details are too numerous to record here. At the altar during the transmission of the method, the master must clearly instruct the disciple, enabling them to understand the origin of the Primal Mandate. The principles of the remaining ranks are all elucidated through the body.

All methods exist in both inner and outer duality. In the heavens, the method of Orthodox Unity’s Alliance of Might is situated within the Celestial Han and Dipper Palace. If we turn inward to the body, the Three Elixir Fields become the Three *Qi*, and the true deities transform into one thousand two hundred forms and ten thousand two thousand radiant spirits. Thus it is said: "Obtaining the Three *Qi* and knowing the origin of the Six Numbers, the yang *qi* transforms into a dragon chariot, and the yin *qi* becomes a jade maiden, soaring without bound and wheeling through the void above."

It is also said: "Where *qi* resides, the spirit is born accordingly." When the spirit is present, *qi* coalesces; when the spirit departs, *qi* disperses. This *qi* is the true *qi* of the Twenty-Four Deities. *Qi* can become spirit, and spirit can become *qi*. When dispersed, *qi* becomes clouds and mist; when gathered, it forms shapes and shadows. Emerging, it becomes immortal transformation; entering, it becomes the True One. Above, it binds the Three Origins; below, it binds the myriad things. In stillness, it functions as my body; in motion, it functions as my spirit. Thus, the accomplishments and functions of the Dao all reside within my body.

For those who cultivate and refine, yin *qi* naturally dissipates, and yang *qi* naturally descends. Without yin *qi*, there is naturally no yin above the Nine Heavens; without yang *qi*, there is naturally no yang below the Nine Earths. This is the meaning of Orthodox Unity’s principle, which lies herein.

The methods of the *Dongxuan Lingbao* liturgical manual are thus concluded.

### **The Method of Invocations Within the Cavernous Mystery and Numinous Treasure Liturgy**

chunks.original_text: 箓者，戒箓情性，止塞愆非，制断恶根，发生道业。 从凡入圣，自始及终，先从戒箓。 然始登真，夫事悉两存，两存理无不通。 箓亦云箓，三天之妙气，十方神仙，灵官名号，与奉道之人修行，故经云：生无道位，死为下鬼。 俗士高人，有希道之心，未能舍世荣禄，初闭不可顿受也。 且受三五阶，若修奉有功，然更迁受。 上古真人，寻诸经记，唯受一二阶修行，便登上真之位，若多受不修行，又不会至理师，又不明修行之由，不能有益道，在用心须真，而又正修行契合，道无不应，其应如神矣。 夫正一箓初流传於世，总有二十四阶以应二十四生气，今略明一二阶以明正一之由。 正一三五一百五十将军箓，有两阶，上阶云上仙，下阶云上灵，俱是人身上二仪之正神也。 又释正一三五混沌元命真人赤箓之由。 正一者，法中王也，制伏邪伪悉归正道。 混沌者，是我身初生受气之时，亦如天地混沌之初也。 元命者，有我身之元命也，知道修其元命，可为真人矣。 元命之理修长，事难具载，临坛授法，度师合明示及弟子，令识元命之由。 余阶之理，不离身上解释也。 夫万法悉有内外两存，以天中指事者正一盟威，处乎皇汉斗宫之中，若内指事以身中者，即三丹田为三气，正神变化有千二百形影，万二千精光，故云得三气之所生能知六数之所因，则阳气化为龙车，阴气变为玉女，腾转无方轮舞空玄之上，又云气之所在，随神所生焉。 神在则气成神，去则气零。 气者则二十四神之正气也，气亦成神，神亦成气，气散之为云雾，合之为形影，出为仙化，入为真一，上结三元，下结万物，静用为我身，动用为我神，故知道成动用悉在我身，修炼之人阴气自消，阳气自降，既无阴气，自然九天之上无阴，九地之下无阳，此之谓也，正一之理即在兹乎。 洞玄灵宝课中法竟
chunks.translated_text:
The register is that which disciplines the emotions and nature through precepts, blocks transgressions and wrongdoing, severs the roots of evil, and gives rise to the Daoist vocation. From the mortal to the sagely, from beginning to end, one must first receive the register of precepts. Thus, when first ascending to the realm of the perfected, all matters exist in duality, and in duality there is no principle that does not penetrate.

The register is also called the "register," the wondrous *qi* of the Three Heavens, the names and titles of the divine officials of the ten directions and the immortals, bestowed upon those who practice the Dao. As the scriptures say: "Those who live without a Daoist rank become lowly ghosts in death." Among worldly scholars and eminent persons who aspire to the Dao but cannot yet relinquish worldly glory and emolument, one cannot receive the register all at once at the outset. They may first receive the third or fifth rank, and if their cultivation bears merit, they may then advance to higher ranks.

The perfected of antiquity, consulting the scriptural records, would receive only one or two ranks for their practice and thereby ascend to the position of the highest perfected. If one receives many ranks but does not cultivate, fails to comprehend the ultimate principle, or does not understand the reasons for practice, it will not benefit the Dao. One must apply the mind with sincerity and align practice with the true Way—then the Dao will unfailingly respond, and its response will be as if divine.

The Orthodox Unity register was first transmitted into the world in twenty-four ranks, corresponding to the twenty-four vital breaths of life. Here, we briefly elucidate one or two ranks to clarify the origin of Orthodox Unity.

The register of the One Hundred Fifty Generals of Orthodox Unity’s Three-Five ranks has two levels: the upper is called "Upper Immortal," and the lower is called "Upper Spirit." Both are the true deities of the Two Modes within the human body.

We further explain the origin of the Orthodox Unity Three-Five Primal Mandate Perfected Person’s Vermilion Register. "Orthodox Unity" is the sovereign of all methods, subduing deceit and falsehood to return all to the true Dao. "Primal Chaos" refers to the moment when my body first received *qi* at birth, akin to the initial chaos of heaven and earth. "Primal Mandate" is the original mandate of my body; one who knows the Dao and cultivates this mandate may become a perfected person. The principles of the Primal Mandate are vast and enduring, and their details are too numerous to record here. At the altar during the transmission of the method, the master must clearly instruct the disciple, enabling them to understand the origin of the Primal Mandate. The principles of the remaining ranks are all elucidated through the body.

All methods exist in both inner and outer duality. In the heavens, the method of Orthodox Unity’s Alliance of Might is situated within the Celestial Han and Dipper Palace. If we turn inward to the body, the Three Elixir Fields become the Three *Qi*, and the true deities transform into one thousand two hundred forms and ten thousand two thousand radiant spirits. Thus it is said: "Obtaining the Three *Qi* and knowing the origin of the Six Numbers, the yang *qi* transforms into a dragon chariot, and the yin *qi* becomes a jade maiden, soaring without bound and wheeling through the void above."

It is also said: "Where *qi* resides, the spirit is born accordingly." When the spirit is present, *qi* coalesces; when the spirit departs, *qi* disperses. This *qi* is the true *qi* of the Twenty-Four Deities. *Qi* can become spirit, and spirit can become *qi*. When dispersed, *qi* becomes clouds and mist; when gathered, it forms shapes and shadows. Emerging, it becomes immortal transformation; entering, it becomes the True One. Above, it binds the Three Origins; below, it binds the myriad things. In stillness, it functions as my body; in motion, it functions as my spirit. Thus, the accomplishments and functions of the Dao all reside within my body.

For those who cultivate and refine, yin *qi* naturally dissipates, and yang *qi* naturally descends. Without yin *qi*, there is naturally no yin above the Nine Heavens; without yang *qi*, there is naturally no yang below the Nine Earths. This is the meaning of Orthodox Unity’s principle, which lies herein.

The methods of the *Dongxuan Lingbao* liturgical manual are thus concluded.
